b55.title: DNA damage-induced phosphorylation of p53 at serine 20 correlates with p21 and Mdm-2 induction in vivo
b55.reason: References 53 and 54 show that p53 phosphorylated at Ser15 and Ser20 displays different roles in auto-regulation and cell cycle checkpoint activation

b112.title: Telomeric DNA damage is irreparable and causes persistent DNA-damage-response activation
b112.reason: The authors demonstrated that the shelterin protein TRF2 prevents the completion of DSB repair by NHEJ in telomeres by inhibiting ligase IV, thereby causing persistent ATM-mediated DDR signalling

b125.title: ROS-induced DNA damage and PARP-1 are required for optimal induction of starvation-induced autophagy
b125.reason: References 117, 119 and 120 describe the fundamental role of PARP1 for survival and regulation of autophagy following DNA damage
